reasons_to_visit.reason: Peak Summer Weather & Lake Geneva Life
reasons_to_visit.details: August typically offers Geneva's warmest weather, perfect for swimming in Lake Geneva (at Bains des Pâquis, Genève Plage), enjoying lakeside cafes, paddleboarding, and maximizing long daylight hours.
Experience Geneva's major summer festival (usually mid-August), featuring lakeside festivities, food stalls, music, attractions, and culminating in a spectacular fireworks display over the lake.
Enjoy ongoing free summer entertainment with diverse concerts (Musiques en été) in parks like Parc La Grange and open-air movie screenings (CinéTransat) at Perle du Lac.

Witness Switzerland's national holiday celebrations, often including official ceremonies, special brunches, and potentially fireworks displays around the lake or surrounding communes (check local regulations).
Warm weather makes it the perfect time for scenic boat trips, from short 'Mouettes' crossings to longer cruises exploring the shores towards Lausanne, Montreux, or Yvoire (France).
Great month for taking the cable car up Mont Salève for views, relaxing in Geneva's numerous parks (La Grange, Eaux-Vives, Bastions), or taking day trips to nearby towns like Annecy or Nyon.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: August is the absolute high season in Geneva. Expect maximum crowds at popular attractions, lakeside spots, and especially during the Fêtes de Genève. Accommodation and flights are at their most expensive.
August can be hot and humid. Afternoon thunderstorms are common and can develop quickly, potentially disrupting outdoor plans or lake activities.

While a major attraction, the Fêtes de Genève significantly impacts the city center and lakefront, causing very large crowds, noise, road closures, and strained public transport, especially during the fireworks.
August is a traditional holiday month for Genevans, meaning some smaller local shops or restaurants might be closed ('fermeture annuelle').
Extremely high demand means accommodation, popular lake cruises, specific restaurant tables (especially with views), and event tickets must be booked very far in advance.
Finding suitable accommodation or desired tour slots last-minute is highly challenging and often impossible during August.

weather.precipitation: Moderate chance of rain, often heavy afternoon thunderstorms. Can be quite humid.
weather.general_tips: Pack light summer clothing (shorts, T-shirts, dresses), swimwear, strong sunscreen, sunglasses, hat. Include a light rain jacket/umbrella for thunderstorms and a layer for potentially cooler evenings.

tourism_level.crowds: Peak season. Extremely busy, especially around August 1st and during the build-up/start of Fêtes de Genève.
tourism_level.pricing: Highest prices of the year for accommodation and flights. Book everything months, if not a year, in advance.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Vibrant, bustling peak summer energy. Strong focus on lakeside activities, outdoor dining, and anticipation/start of the Fêtes de Genève.

events_holidays.name: Swiss National Day (Fête Nationale)
events_holidays.description: National holiday. Official ceremonies, flags displayed. Check Geneva city/canton website for specific events like fireworks, bonfires (can be restricted due to dryness), or public celebrations.
events_holidays.notes: Public holiday - most shops closed. Restaurants/attractions generally open. Expect patriotic displays and local gatherings.

events_holidays.name: Start of Fêtes de Genève (Potentially)
events_holidays.description: The main summer festival begins, with initial setup of food stalls, attractions, and potentially early events along the lakefront.
events_holidays.notes: Check the official festival website for the exact start date and initial program.

events_holidays.name: Musiques en été / CinéTransat Continue
events_holidays.description: Ongoing free concerts in parks and open-air cinema screenings.
events_holidays.notes: Check respective programs for schedules and locations.

unique_experiences.activity: Swim & Relax at Bains des Pâquis
unique_experiences.description: Join locals at this iconic, budget-friendly lakeside swimming spot. Sunbathe on the jetty, swim in the lake, enjoy the sauna (mixed/women-only sections), or grab affordable food/drinks at the 'buvette'.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Small entry fee. Can get very crowded. Offers great views of the Jet d'Eau. Lively social atmosphere.

unique_experiences.description: Experience the Genevan summer evening tradition of an 'apéro' (pre-dinner drinks and snacks) at a spot with lake views as the sun begins to set.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Popular spots fill quickly. Reservations recommended for some bars/restaurants.

unique_experiences.where: Various stops around the inner lake
unique_experiences.description: Use the small yellow shuttle boats for quick, scenic transport across the lake between points like Pâquis, Molard (Old Town), Eaux-Vives, and Perle du Lac.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Part of the public transport network (TPG ticket valid). Frequent service. Offers great close-up views from the water.

unique_experiences.activity: Explore the Old Town (Vieille Ville) & Bastions Park
unique_experiences.description: Wander the shaded alleys of the Old Town, visit St. Pierre Cathedral, then relax in the adjacent Parc des Bastions, see the Reformation Wall, and maybe play giant chess.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Old Town offers shade from the sun. Bastions Park is flat and good for escaping city heat.
unique_experiences.best_time: Morning or late afternoon to avoid midday heat.

weather.precipitation: Continued chance of afternoon thunderstorms. Days remain warm, but evenings might feel slightly less hot towards the end of the month.
weather.general_tips: Similar packing to early August. Always carry water. Be prepared for sudden downpours.

tourism_level.crowds: Remains very high, especially if Fêtes de Genève is ongoing. Might see a slight decrease in family tourists towards month-end as European holidays finish.
tourism_level.pricing: Stays at peak levels. Booking far in advance remains critical.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Dominated by Fêtes de Genève if running. Otherwise, a continuation of peak summer buzz, though perhaps with a subtle 'end of summer' feeling emerging.

events_holidays.name: Fêtes de Genève (Main Events & Fireworks)
events_holidays.date: Usually mid-August, including a key Saturday for fireworks (check exact dates)
events_holidays.description: Peak of the summer festival. Lakefront packed with food stalls, music stages, funfair. Grand fireworks display over the lake is the main highlight.
events_holidays.notes: Extremely crowded, especially for fireworks. Plan viewing spots and transport well in advance. Major disruptions.

events_holidays.name: La Bâtie-Festival de Genève (Potentially Starts)
events_holidays.date: Usually starts late August/early September (check exact dates)
events_holidays.description: Contemporary arts festival featuring music, theatre, and dance across various city venues.
events_holidays.notes: Check program and book tickets if interested in specific performances.

events_holidays.name: End of Musiques en été / CinéTransat
events_holidays.description: Final chances to catch free summer concerts or open-air movies.
events_holidays.notes: Check respective schedules for final dates.

unique_experiences.activity: Watch the Fêtes de Genève Fireworks
unique_experiences.where: Best views from Jardin Anglais, Quai Gustave-Ador, Mont Blanc Bridge (crowded!), Bains des Pâquis area
unique_experiences.description: Witness the spectacular hour-long fireworks display over Lake Geneva, a highlight of the summer.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Arrive HOURS early to secure a decent spot. Expect massive crowds and difficult movement/transport after. Consider paid viewing areas/boats if available/desired.
unique_experiences.best_time: Fireworks evening (usually a Saturday in mid-Aug)
unique_experiences.estimated_cost: Free (public viewing), costs for food/drinks or paid spots

unique_experiences.activity: Paddleboarding or Kayaking on the Lake
unique_experiences.description: Rent a stand-up paddleboard (SUP) or kayak to explore the lake at your own pace and get a different perspective of the city.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Best on calm days. Wear swimwear/quick-dry clothing. Stay within designated areas, mindful of boats.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the charming 'Venice of the Alps' with its canals, beautiful lake, medieval Old Town, and castle.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Frequent bus connections from Geneva Gare Routière. Bring passport. Can be very busy in August.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the history of watchmaking and admire an extraordinary collection of timepieces, including Patek Philippe creations and antique watches.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check opening hours (often closed Sun/Mon). Allow 1.5-2 hours. Photography usually restricted.
